title: 8 possible cut or trade candidates for Patriots ahead of NFL free agency
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: The Patriots are considering cutting several players to create cap space for the 2026 free agency.
Stefon Diggs is a potential cut despite being a key player due to his $20 million contract.
Christian Elliss may face cuts due to lack of guaranteed money and underwhelming performance in 2025.

title: Jayson Tatum won’t make return from Achilles tear in Celtics’ matchup vs. 76ers
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Jayson Tatum will not return for the Celtics against the 76ers as he recovers from a right Achilles tendon injury.
Joel Embiid will miss Sunday's game against the Celtics due to an oblique strain, expected to miss three games total.
The Celtics are 1-2 against the 76ers this season, with each game decided by two points or less.

title: Jarren Duran’s hot start to spring training continues, hitting 2 homers vs. Twins. What could it mean for Red Sox’ lineup?
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jarren Duran hit two home runs against the Twins in the Red Sox' Grapefruit League game on Saturday.
Duran has struggled against left-handed pitchers but has hit two homers against them in consecutive spring games.
Red Sox manager Alex Cora may reconsider lineup roles as Duran shows power potential, with three homers in early spring training.

title: As 2025-26 Bruins exceed expectations, so has their prospect pool in college hockey
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Bruins prospects James Hagens and Dean Letourneau scored a combined 39 goals for Boston College in the 2025-26 season.
Seven Bruins-drafted players participated in the rivalry game between Boston College and Boston University at Agganis Arena.
The Bruins have improved significantly, with a record of 13-2-3 since December 31, 2025, under coach Marco Sturm.

title: Celtics ‘clear pick’ to win the East? One NBA assistant coach reportedly feels that way
author: Conor Roche
bullets: An unnamed NBA assistant coach believes the Boston Celtics are favorites to win the Eastern Conference.
The Celtics are second in the Eastern Conference, trailing the Detroit Pistons by 5.5 games.
Boston is slightly ahead of Detroit in net rating; Celtics boast stronger offensive creators.

title: Review and setlist: Jason Isbell and the 400 Unit bring a well-rounded Americana showcase to Boston
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Jason Isbell and the 400 Unit performed at the Boch Center Wang Theatre in Boston on February 27, 2026.
The setlist included songs like 'It Gets Easier,' 'Bury Me,' 'Elephant,' and covers like 'Can't You Hear Me Knocking.'
Isbell showcased a range of genres, featuring Americana, Southern rock, and folk with both electric and acoustic arrangements.

title: Latest reports suggest Patriots are unlikely to land big-name edge rusher before NFL Draft
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots unlikely to secure top edge rushers Maxx Crosby or Trey Hendrickson before the NFL Draft.
Patriots may be priced out of top free agents like Jaelan Phillips and Odafe Oweh.
Missouriâ€™s Zion Young is a potential draft target for Patriots with the 31st pick, offering promising defensive stats.

title: What Paramount’s pending purchase of Warner Bros. Discovery means for sports fans
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Paramount Skydance set to purchase Warner Brothers Discovery for $110 billion, pending regulatory approval.
CBS and TNT/TBS may integrate for sports coverage, impacting NCAA, MLB, and NHL broadcasts.
Netflix explores expanding NFL streaming rights after backing out of Warner Brothers Discovery purchase.

title: Patriots reportedly interested in A.J. Brown, but not at Eagles’ current asking price
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Patriots are interested in A.J. Brown, but find the Eagles' asking price of first and second-round picks too high.
Trading A.J. Brown before June 1 could cost the Eagles nearly $44 million in dead money and reduce cap space by $20 million.
Patriots consider keeping Stefon Diggs and trading for Brown, which may require Diggs to restructure his $26.5 million cap hit.

title: Bye-bye transponders: E-ZPass switching to stickers
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Massachusetts E-ZPass moving from hard-plastic transponders to free RFID sticker tags starting Sunday.
The new sticker tags are cheaper to produce at 55 cents compared to $6.70 for transponders.
State officials project $7.4 million in annual savings by switching from transponders to sticker tags.
